results.title: The Sound of a Meringue Being Tortured
results.creator_credit: Antony Riddell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. A stop-motion animated short film where the characters repeatedly ask ‘Are you alright, mate?’.

results.title: Flatworms: platyhelminthes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
After brief views of land, fresh water, marine and parasitic flatworms, shows the important characteristics of the common planaria. These are the simplest animals with bilateral symmetry, a distinct head, a central nervous system and a substantially developed mesoderm layer. Their regenerative ability is demonstrated, showing polarity, the anterior-posterior gradient and cell dominance.

results.title: Coming together
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tolmie is a small town in north-eastern Victoria with a surprisingly rich and varied social life. A town with no shops, cafes or main drag to speak of, Tolmie boasts over a dozen clubs, groups and community groups, all of whom came together one night tell us what makes Tolmie tick. Centering around the Pub and the community-restored Mechanic’s Hall, everyone from the ‘Secret Bikers Stuff’ group, to the ‘Unfinished Craft Object’ (UFO for short) club, gather to share the secrets of their resourcefulness, irreverent sense of humour and collaborative spirit.

results.title: Change
results.creator_credit: Michelle Huynh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Huynh’s high school years were peppered with having to change schools. In that, she had to adjust to a new area, and more importantly, make new friends. In time, Michelle has learnt to see the changes she dreaded so much as a good thing.

results.title: The Journalist
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Pom Oliver and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Follow the turbulent fortunes of Simon Morris, a top reporter and feature writer for a major daily newspaper. The newspaper is just a background to Simon’s lifestyle, particularly his relationship with women. Stars Jack Thompson, Elizabeth Alexander and Sam Neill.

results.title: Kyara
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hank Kerr
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This film is a message from Hank Kerr to his daughter, Kyara. It speaks about his alcoholism and determination to become a better person for the sake of his daughter. Kerr also talks about the jobs he has had including as a clown in the first Aboriginal Clown troop called the Oogadee Boogadees.
results.description:

results.title: Warlords: Battlecry for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, CD case insert, reference card, epilepsy warning sheet, advert and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group

results.title: Emulation of Warlords: Battlecry for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.brief_description: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.description: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.
description_for_label: As part of the Warlords series, Warlords Battlecry retains the fantasy setting and tactical focus of its predecessors. However, if shifts from the wargame genre that the series is known for to a mix of real-time strategy and roleplaying. The players commands one of nine races – Human, Dwarf, Undead, Barbarians, Orcs, Minotaurs, High Elves, Wood Elves and Dark Elves. True to real-time strategy genre, buildings must be created, units trained, upgrades researched and resources gathered. Unique to this game is the addition of hero units, which can complete quests and gain experience, strength and skills, unlike the other units in their army.

results.title: Triptych
results.creator_credit: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Bird, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
description_for_label: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.
